Package org.cesecore.util

Class StringTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.util.StringTools
  • public final class StringTools
extends Object
    This class implements some utility functions that are useful when handling Strings.
    Version:
    $Id: StringTools.java 30973 2019-01-03 14:33:40Z samuellb $

      • ipOctetsToString

        public static String ipOctetsToString​(byte[] octets)
        Converts ip-adress octets, according to ipStringToOctets to human readable string in form 10.1.1.1 for ipv4 adresses.
        Parameters:
        octets - bytes
        Returns:
        ip address string, null if input is invalid
        See Also:
        ipStringToOctets(String)

      • ipStringToOctets

        public static byte[] ipStringToOctets​(String str)
        Converts an IP-address string to octets of binary ints. ipv4 is of form a.b.c.d, i.e. at least four octets for example 192.168.5.54 ipv6 is of form a:b:c:d:e:f:g:h, for example 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334 Result is tested with openssl, that it's subjectAltName displays as intended.
        Parameters:
        str - string form of ip-address
        Returns:
        octets, empty array if input format is invalid, never null

      • isIpAddress

        public static boolean isIpAddress​(String ipAddress)
        Determine if the given string is a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address. This method uses pattern matching to see if the given string could be a valid IP address. Snitched from http://www.java2s.com/Code/Java/Network-Protocol/DetermineifthegivenstringisavalidIPv4orIPv6address.htm Under LGPLv2 license.
        Parameters:
        ipAddress - A string that is to be examined to verify whether or not it could be a valid IP address.
        Returns:
        true if the string is a value that is a valid IP address, false otherwise.

      • isValidSanDnsName

        public static boolean isValidSanDnsName​(String dnsName)
        Check if a string constitutes a valid hostname for the dNSName attribute of the Subject Alternative Name X.509 certificate extension. This method does NOT check if the hostname can be resolved to an IP address, is registered with ICANN ect. Instead, the following checks are performed:
        • Any leading wildcard is stripped.
        • The DNS name is not allowed to end with a dot.
        • The input most be a syntactically valid hostname as per RFC 2181 and RFC 3490.
        • The domain name must not be a registry suffix.
        • The domain name must not be a top-level domain.
        This implementation is null-safe and relies on Guava's InternetDomainName implementation for hostname validation and identification of registry suffices and TLDs.

        Identification of TLDs and registry suffices are currently not supported because this functionality requires a newer version of the Guava library.

        Parameters:
        dnsName - the DNS name to check
        Returns:
        true if the input is valid SAN dNSName attribute value

      • putBase64String

        public static String putBase64String​(String s)
        Takes input and converts to Base64 on the format "B64:<base64 endoced string>", if the string is not null or empty.
        Parameters:
        s - String to base64 encode
        Returns:
        Base64 encoded string, or original string if it was null or empty

      • putBase64String

        public static String putBase64String​(String s,
                                     boolean dontEncodeAsciiPrintable)
        Takes input and converts to Base64 on the format "B64:<base64 endoced string>", if the string is not null or empty.
        Parameters:
        s - String to base64 encode
        dontEncodeAsciiPrintable - if the String is made up of pure ASCII printable characters, we will not B64 encode it
        Returns:
        Base64 encoded string, or original string if it was null or empty

      • getBase64String

        public static String getBase64String​(String input)

        Parameters:
        input - String to Base64 decode
        Returns:
        Base64 decoded string, or original string if it was not base64 encoded

      • obfuscate

        public static String obfuscate​(String s)
        Makes a string "hard" to read. Does not provide any real security, but at least lets you hide passwords so that people with no malicious intent don't accidentally stumble upon information they should not have.
        Parameters:
        s - string to obfuscate
        Returns:
        an obfuscated string, or same as input if null or empty

      • deobfuscateIf

        Parameters:
        s - string to deobfuscate
        Returns:
        a deobfuscated string, or the original if it does not start with OBF:
        See Also:
        deobfuscate(String)

        public static String deobfuscate​(String in)

        Parameters:
        in - obfuscated string, usually (but not necessarily) starts with OBF:
        Returns:
        plain text string, or original if it was empty

        Method takes an encrypted string (by using the methods in this class) and returns the method used to encrypt the string with
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        "legacy" for old data, "encv1" or later to describe a specific version

      • pbeEncryptStringWithSha256Aes192

        public static String pbeEncryptStringWithSha256Aes192​(String in)
                                               throws InvalidKeyException,
                                                      InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                                      IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                                      BadPaddingException,
                                                      InvalidKeySpecException
        Method used for encrypting a string. Note that this method does provide limited security (e.g. DBA's won't be able to access encrypted passwords in database) as long as the 'password.encryption.key' is set, otherwise, it won't provide any real encryption more than obfuscation.
        Parameters:
        in - string
        Returns:
        encrypted string
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if key invalid
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if algo invalid
        IllegalBlockSizeException - if block size invalid
        BadPaddingException - if padding invalid
        InvalidKeySpecException - if spec invalis

      • pbeEncryptStringWithSha256Aes192

        public static String pbeEncryptStringWithSha256Aes192​(String in,
                                                      char[] p)
                                               throws InvalidKeyException,
                                                      IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                                      BadPaddingException,
                                                      InvalidKeySpecException
        Parameters:
        in - clear text string to encrypt
        p - encryption passphrase
        Returns:
        hex encoded encrypted data in form "encryption_version:salt:count:encrypted_data" or clear text string if no strong crypto is available (Oracle JVM without unlimited strength crypto policy files)
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if key invalid
        IllegalBlockSizeException - if block size invalid
        BadPaddingException - if padding invalid
        InvalidKeySpecException - if spec invalis

      • pbeDecryptStringWithSha256Aes192

        public static String pbeDecryptStringWithSha256Aes192​(String in)
                                               throws InvalidKeyException,
                                                      IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                                      BadPaddingException,
                                                      InvalidKeySpecException
        Parameters:
        in - hex encoded encrypted string in form "encryption_version:salt:count:encrypted_data", or just "encrypted_data" for older versions
        Returns:
        decrypted clear text string
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if key invalid
        IllegalBlockSizeException - if block size invalid
        BadPaddingException - if padding invalid
        InvalidKeySpecException - if spec invalis

      • pbeDecryptStringWithSha256Aes192

        public static String pbeDecryptStringWithSha256Aes192​(String in,
                                                      char[] p)
                                               throws IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                                      BadPaddingException,
                                                      InvalidKeyException,
                                                      InvalidKeySpecException
        Parameters:
        in - hex encoded encrypted string in form "encryption_version:salt:count:encrypted_data", or just "encrypted_data" for older versions
        p - decryption passphrase
        Returns:
        decrypted clear text string
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if key invalid
        IllegalBlockSizeException - if block size invalid
        BadPaddingException - if padding invalid
        InvalidKeySpecException - if spec invalis

      • passwordDecryption

        public static String passwordDecryption​(String in,
                                        String sDebug)
        Method to handle different versions of password encryption transparently
        Parameters:
        in - The encrypted or clear text password to try to decrypt
        sDebug - A message to put in the debug log indicating where the password came from, for example 'autoactivation pin', do NOT put the password itself here
        Returns:
        The decrypted password, or same as input if it was not encrypted

      • incrementKeySequence

        public static String incrementKeySequence​(int keySequenceFormat,
                                          String oldSequence)

      • splitURIs

        public static Collection<String> splitURIs​(String dPoints)
        Splits a string with semicolon separated and optionally double-quoted strings into a collection of strings.

        Strings that contains semicolon has to be quoted. Unbalanced quotes (the end quote is missing) is handled as if there was a quote at the end of the string. 

         Examples:
 splitURIs("a;b;c") => [a, b, c]
 splitURIs("a;\"b;c\";d") => [a, b;c, d]
 splitURIs("a;\"b;c;d") => [a, b;c;d]

        See org.ejbca.core.model.ca.certextensions.TestCertificateExtensionManager#test03TestSplitURIs() for more examples.

        Parameters:
        dPoints - The semicolon separated string and which optionally uses double-quotes
        Returns:
        A collection of strings

      • parseCertData

        public static String[] parseCertData​(String certdata)
        Parses the given string according to a specific format based on the certificate-data stored in the LogEntryData table in the database.
        Parameters:
        certdata - the string containing the certificate details
        Returns:
        a String array with two elements, the first is the certificate serialnumber and the second one is the certificate issuerDN

      • getCleanXForwardedFor

        public static String getCleanXForwardedFor​(String rawHeaderValue)
        Parameters:
        rawHeaderValue - value
        Returns:
        the IP address of the X-Forwarded-For HTTP header with illegal chars replaced with '?'. IPv6 address hex chars are converted to lower case.

      • checkFieldForLegalChars

        public static boolean checkFieldForLegalChars​(String value)
        Checks a string for legal chars (not containing "/[^\\u0041-\\u005a\\u0061-\\u007a\\u00a1-\\ud7ff\\ue000-\\uffff_ 0-9@\\.\\*\\,\\-:\\/\\?\\'\\=\\(\\)\\|.]/g").

        Returns:
        true if the string only contains legal characters.

      • isAlphaOrAsciiPrintable

        public static boolean isAlphaOrAsciiPrintable​(String str)
        Parameters:
        str - string
        Returns:
        false of if the string contains any characters that are neither a letter (unicode) or an asciiPrintable character

      • isLesserThan

        public static boolean isLesserThan​(String first,
                                   String second)
        Takes two versions and compares the first and the second versions to each other Compares the max amount of numbers on both. So 6.1.2.3,6.1.2 will try to compare 4 numbers, adding a 0, i.e. 6.1.2.3,6.1.2.0
        Parameters:
        first - a version number
        second - a version number
        Returns:
        true of the first version is lower (1.0 < 2.0) than the second, false otherwise.

      • normalizeNewlines

        public static String normalizeNewlines​(String s)
        Changes Windows (\r\n) and Mac (\r) line endings into \n line endings.
        Parameters:
        s - Input string. May be null
        Returns:
        Output string, or null if input string was null

      • splitByNewlines

        public static String[] splitByNewlines​(String s)
        Splits a string by newlines (may be \n, \r\n or \r).
        Parameters:
        s - Input string. May not be null.
        Returns:
        Array of lines, never null. May be an empty list and may contains empty strings.
